pages.text: Producing sugar is a much more involved process in Artisanal than it is in ordinary TerraFirmaCraft, but the results are much more...okay, so they're actually less useful. But hey, realism!
The first step to processing sugarcane is to clean it, which can be done by sealing it in a water barrel for 8 hours.
Alternatively, sugarcane can be cleaned instantly using $(l:tfc:artisanal/soap)Soapy Water$().
The sugarcane is then $(l:tfc:artisanal/juicing)Juiced$() in a Quern to create $(thing)Sugarcane Juice.

During this process, $(thing)Dry Bagasse$() is created as a by-product. It can be used as firepit fuel, kindling, or compost. $(br2)Sugarcane Juice can be boiled in a pot to create $(thing)Perishable Sugar$(). $(thing)Molassess$() is also produced as a by-product.
Alternatively, the Sugarcane Juice can be further filtered using $(thing)Jute Nets$().
The juice is then alkalized using Lime.
Then, the lime is filtered out using Jute Nets once again, leaving it clarified. $(br2)Clarified Sugarcane Juice is then boiled into Non-Perishable Sugar. Molasses is also produced as a by-product.
You can blow the fumes from hot Sulfur onto non-perishable sugar with a $(thing)Tuyere$() to make $(thing)White Sugar$().
Molasses can be fermented into Rum. It can also be drunk normally and grants $(l)$(a)Fruit$() and $(l)$(2)Vegetable$() nutrition.
